author: parithosh
content:
The 1.4M test will have genesis in the next ~10mins. We should have some early metrics in time for the ACD call today. 

We're following strict mainnet distributions(Prysm 43%, lighthouse 33.5%, teku 17.5%, nimbus 5% and lodestar 1%), kept the same number of nodes (420) but reduced the number of keys/node (3300/host) to help alleviate some load. 

IP addresses can be found here: https://github.com/ethpandaops/holesky-test/blob/master/ansible/inventories/devnet-2m-test/inventory.ini

Network configs: https://github.com/ethpandaops/holesky-test/tree/master/network-configs/devnet-2m-test
genesis.ssz: https://2m-val-test.fra1.cdn.digitaloceanspaces.com/genesis.ssz

The summary of the run can be found here (once we have data): https://notes.ethereum.org/@parithosh/bigboi-beaconchain-3

content: ^ we just had genesis

author: barnabasbusa
content: any reason why epoch 0/1 would be such trouble for prysm ?

author: nishant0
content: Great ! Yeap , there is a caching edge case at genesis. We havent tackled it because it cant be hit in any active  network anymore , and fixing it would require complicating our cache. We opted to leave this edge case open

author: parithosh
content: Nice, we have finality ðŸ˜„

author: nishant0
content: After looking at the data from the previous 2.1 million testnet,as jacek mentioned above,  I think subscribing to  all subnets has an adverse effect on a Prysm node's ability to propagate its own attestations. The node seems to be able to process and produce blocks in a timely fashion, but I suspect gossip queues are overloaded due to each node subscribing to all the subnets. So you have a node's attestations being dropped before it can be broadcasted out to the network.

author: parithosh
content: Makes sense! Wouldn't the same effect also mostly be seen on mainnet at these loads - considering most professional node operators would likely be subscibing to all subnets anyway?

author: nishant0
content: Mainnet is a 1/3 rd of the load of the big devnet, which is probably why it isnt an issue

author: barnabasbusa
content: half.

author: parithosh
content: Ah you're talking about the 2.1M test, we're talking about the ~1.4M test

author: nishant0
content: Ah yes, its for the 2.1m test

author: parithosh
content: Prysm logs indicate a ton of `root .... :  not a checkpoint in forkchoice` (Seems to mainly be from teku/lighthouse nodes), any idea why?

author: nishant0
content: Its possible some nodes are stuck , so prysm ignores these attestation which are voting for an old checkpoint

author: parithosh
content:
docker logs beacon 2>&1 | grep -c "not a checkpoint"
11759 in total

6016 from lighthouse
4110 from teku
342 from prysm
17 from nimbus
0 from lodetar

content: Note: We'll be deleting the testnet ~12h from now. We'll collect logs from 1 machine of each, the metrics will be persisted for a few more months and we'll collect some profiler data for Teku. If there's anything else that's useful, please grab it now or let us know!
